title: Elec. system underrepresents small parties in UK

content.prompt: Which of the following is a consequence of the United Kingdom's single-member district plurality electoral system?

choices.label: Third parties without specific regional support are often underrepresented in Parliament.
British elections are not particularly free, fair, or competitive across the country.
Ethnoreligious minorities have a very large representation in Parliament and the executive cabinet.
Local governing authorities are appointed and have almost no political power.

unit.text: 4: Party and Electoral Systems and Citizen Organizations

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Explain how political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors apply in a course country.
